answers.answer: I am sorry about your mom. For you, diabetes is a concern. You should really see a doctor for testing. Diabetes is not the curse it once was, as it can be managed with medications and proper diet. Also with being flatfooted, you may be having some issues with pain in your feet that radiate.  You may consider seeing a foot doctor who can prescribe orthotic insoles for you.Hope you feel better soon.

question: I get sudden pains in my fingertips and I get serious pain in the bottom of my feet.  On my right leg near the pocket area, I can't have metal in the pocket.  If I do have metal in the pocket I get pain in my leg in the area where the metal is.  I was born with flat feet which might be a part of it.  I have been typing a lot at the keyboard which might be a part of it also.   I am about 280 lbs at 5'11".  Ever since my Mom went to heaven on about the anniversary of 9/11/2001, I haven been putting on weight and have not been able to take much off and keep it off.  I worked as a Security Officer at a major airport and spent about 4 months doing a lot of repetive motions and some of them were with a lot of weight (passengers baggage, laptops and so on).  My Father has or had adult onset diabetes  and i'm concerned it might be diabetes but don't want to go to the Veterans Administration.  I feel that If I am diagnosed with diabetes, I'll have a curse for the rest of my life of diabetes.  I have heard a television program that there are people that have overcome diabetes and I believe that this could happen of this is the problem.    Please help me..
title: Medical Condition or Spiritual Battle?
